thread.title: Conan O'Brien surprises Patriots Super Bowl hero with new car
thread.title_full: Conan O'Brien surprises Patriots Super Bowl hero with new car

title: Conan O'Brien surprises Patriots Super Bowl hero with new car
text:
Conan O'Brien surprises Patriots Super Bowl hero with new truck By Frank Pallotta, CNN Updated 0325 GMT (1125 HKT) February 10, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. (CNN) Running back James White may have scored the winning touchdown for the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LI on Sunday, but he didn't win the game's Most Valuable Player award. On Thursday, Conan O'Brien did what he could to soften that blow a bit. The TBS late night host had White on during his opening monologue Thursday night to discuss the Patriots victory Sunday -- which was the largest comeback in Super Bowl history. After White scored the winning touchdown in overtime, Patriots quarterback and this year's Super Bowl MVP recipient Tom Brady said that White deserved the Super Bowl MVP award instead of himself. That included all the spoils that went along with it. And once upon a time, that included a new car. Read More But players no longer receive a new car for winning the game's MVP trophy. Despite White not winning the award officially, and that part of the official prize having been discontinued, O'Brien and Ford surprised White on Thursday night's show with a new Ford F-150 truck. "That's right, you can have this truck for 24 hours," O'Brien said, jokingly. The host, whose show is based in Los Angeles, then laughed with White telling him he'll have to now "drive back to Boston." This isn't the first time that O'Brien, who is a huge Patriots fan, has had some fun with players from the team. Last week O'Brien had Brady and other Patriots play video games in the Super Bowl edition of his popular segment "Clueless Gamer." O'Brien's big surprise takes place on TBS' "Conan" at 11 p.m. ET on Thursday night. Follow Us © 2017 Cable News Network. Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
